other_tests.findings: CSF glucose level of 4.7 mmol/L, protein level of 0.6 mg/L, 6 white cells to 327 red cells per high-power field.
Histological analysis of the biopsy specimen revealed normal brain tissue with hemorrhagic infiltration.
PT greater than 160 seconds, aPTT greater than 200 seconds.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Repeated tests showed PT of 32 seconds and aPTT of 42.9 seconds.

other_tests.findings: PT = 37 seconds, aPTT = 42.9 seconds, and plasma D-dimer levels were elevated.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Some improvement in PT and aPTT levels, although still abnormal.

other_tests.findings: An involuting contrast-enhancing nidus in the hematoma cavity.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Involution of the contrast-enhancing nidus observed over time.
